data.question: What is the formula of the chiral metal-organic framework synthesized?
At what temperature were the magnetic susceptibilities of the synthesized sample measured?
What method was used to confirm the supramolecular enantiomeric nature of 1(cid:2)solv?
What is the critical temperature (Tc1) for the first step of the spin crossover behavior?
What are the two potential chiral coordination modes of Fe in the formula Fe(mptpy)2?
What is the purpose of using a Jasco CDF-426S thermo controller in the experiment?
data.answer: For variable-temperature CD spectra from 278 K to 373 K

data.question: What does the presence of two peaks in the DSC measurement indicate?
data.answer: The second step transition and the loss of guest molecules

data.question: Why were the guests in the 3D framework not well refined in crystallographic analysis?
data.answer: Because the guests were disordered and could not be well refined

data.question: How does the addition of ethylene glycol affect the yield of 1∙solv?
data.answer: It increases the yield of 1∙solv to 63% but results in much smaller crystals

data.question: What does the variable temperature Raman experiment indicate about the structural rearrangement?
data.answer: It indicates the possibility of synergetic structural rearrangement of the whole lattice

data.question: What is the significance of the blue shift observed in the Raman spectra?
data.answer: It is consistent with the two-step SCO behavior

data.question: What does the presence of a plateau in the magnetic susceptibility data suggest?
data.answer: An approximately 50% distribution of the HS and LS states

data.question: Is the framework of 1∙solv stable up to 653 K?
Does the synthesis of 1∙solv involve spontaneous resolution?
Is the chiral SCO material based on 1∙solv expected to have nondestructive readout properties?
Does the desolvated sample 1 exhibit the same SCO behavior as 1∙solv?
Is the Fe–Naverage bond length increase from 150 K to 373 K indicative of a transition from HS to LS state?
Does the TG analysis show decomposition of the framework before 735 K?
Is the bulk sample of 1∙solv a racemic mixture?
Are the guests in the 3D framework well defined in the crystallographic analysis?
